- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.48.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://img.chkaja.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Chinese filter

_No response_

`chkaja.com` is a personal blog domain. And `img.chkaja.com` is an image hosting domain. Block rules in filter make website can't show properly.  #146588

issue.title: netcine.to
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://netcine.to](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnetcine.to) ### Comment > O site netcine.to está dando uma bela rasteira nos desenvolvedores do adguard, a principio o player do vídeo não roda com a presença do plug-in (Firefox, Chrome, edge) mesmo desativado > outro ponto importante é que não é apenas em um navegador, são quase todos que dão suporte ao adguard. > não se trata de um bug do site, não se trata do bug de navegador, simplesmente usam uma falha.. se os outros sites começarem a usar isso, não vai servir pra nada um adblock. > > usando google translator: > > The site netcine.to is giving a beautiful creep in the developers of adguard, at first the video player does not run with the presence of the plug-in (Firefox, Chrome, edge) even disabled > another important point is that it is not only in one browser, it is almost all that support adguard. > it's not a site bug, it's not the browser bug, they just use a glitch. if the other sites start using this, it won't serve an adblock at all. > > ### Screenshots

comment.body:
> Could you please add all these rules:
> 
> ```
> outlook.live.com#@?#div.customScrollBar > div > div > div > div > div > div:-abp-has(div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > i[data-icon-name="Delete"] + div[class])
> outlook.live.com#@?##app > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[class]:not(.ms-FocusZone):not([class^="screenReaderText"]) div[data-max-width][data-skip-link-name] > div[style^="padding-right:"] + div[tabindex] div.customScrollBar > div[class] > div[class]:not([id]):not([data-convid]):-abp-has(> div:not([class]) div[class] > div[style] + div.fbAdLink)
> outlook.live.com#@?##app > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[class]:not(.ms-FocusZone):not([class^="screenReaderText"]) div[data-max-width] + div[class]:-abp-has(> div[class] > div > div[id^="owaadbar"])
> outlook.live.com#@?#.customScrollBar[data-is-scrollable] > div[class] > div[class]:not([data-convid]):-abp-has(> div:not([id]):not([class]) > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > .fbAdLink)
> outlook.live.com#@?##app > .ms-Fabric > div[class] > div[class] > div[class]:-abp-has(> div > div > div[id^="owaadbar"])
> outlook.live.com#@?#div:-abp-has(> div > div.fbAdLink)
> ```
> 
> to user rules and then check if issue still occurs?
> 
> If messages will be displayed correctly, then please disable rules one by one until issue will start occurring again and please post the rule(s) which fixes problem.

Testing these, it looks like only this rule (the first one) is required to fix the problem:

`outlook.live.com#@?#div.customScrollBar > div > div > div > div > div > div:-abp-has(div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > i[data-icon-name="Delete"] + div[class])`
